events.title: US says 11 people killed in latest strikes on alleged drug boats
events.description: Three boats targeted in eastern Pacific and Caribbean as Trump continues pursuit of alleged ‚Äònarco-terrorists‚Äô US military officials have said American forces launched assaults on three alleged drug-smuggling boats, killing 11 in one of the deadliest days of the Trump administration‚Äôs months-long campaign against alleged traffickers. The military action on Monday brought the number of fatalities caused by US strikes to 145 since September, when Donald Trump called on American armed forces to attack people deemed ‚Äúnarco-terrorists‚Äù on small vessels. There have been 42 known strikes in notorious drug-trafficking routes such as the Caribbean Sea and eastern Pacific Ocean, according to the Associated Press reported . Continue reading...

After moving to the UK and marrying a British woman, he became a restaurateur and an avid keeper of birds. All the while, however ‚Äì as the Guardian‚Äôs community affairs correspondent, Chris Osuh , explains ‚Äì he was hiding a secret: he had pledged allegiance to Islamic State. Continue reading...

For years, she has sat as a judge at the international criminal court, weighing accusations of war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity; now she is on the same list as terrorists and those involved in organised crime. ‚ÄúIt really was a moment of a bit of disbelief,‚Äù she said. events.title: Australia news live: Burke says Australian citizens in Syria have a right to passports; Sydney man charged over alleged death threats to federal MP
events.description: Home affairs minister says opposition had repatriated Australians from Syria when in government. Follow today‚Äôs news live Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Jonno Duniam , the shadow home affairs minister, spoke about the passports this morning as the opposition seeks to hammer the government on the matter. He told Channel Seven‚Äôs Sunrise reports those in the group had travel documents was ‚Äúof incredible concern, I think, to most Australians that these people want to come back to Australia‚Äù, adding: And if one person has been hit with a temporary exclusion order for going to this part of world and doing what they‚Äôve done, why is it not the case that the others have not had the same order applied against them? I would be very interested to know what advice there is on the others because I think the fact that they‚Äôve all gone to the same place for the same purpose ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not sure how you can differentiate between them. But putting that to one side, if our laws aren‚Äôt strong enough to protect us, to prevent people who‚Äôve gone to support Isis from coming back to this country, then the government should look at expanding and strengthening those laws and we stand as an opposition ready to work with them. I think I‚Äôm giving the very practical answer that if anyone applies for a passport as a citizen, they are issued with a passport, in the same way that if someone applies for a Medicare card, they get a Medicare card. These are automatic processes done by public servants. Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: üí• Australia news live: Burke says Australian citizens in Syria have a right to passports; Sydney man charged over alleged death threats to federal MP

The first six months of data since the Albanese government introduced a new vehicle efficiency standard shows 40 companies ‚Äì 68% of the total ‚Äì beat their initial target for the average emissions efficiency of the new cars they sold. events.title: Former Pentagon official on the latest talks between the US and Iran
events.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with former Pentagon official Dana Stroul about the latest round of Iran talks and the potential for military action.

events.title: The last newspaper hawker in Paris honored with knighthood
events.description: Ali Akbar, a 73-year-old immigrant from Pakistan, has been hawking papers on the streets of Paris for the last 50 years. French President Emmanuel Macron honored him with a knighthood late last month.

events.title: Venezuela's oil revival brings hope but little relief for workers
events.description: As U.S. sanctions ease and oil money begins to trickle back after Nicol√°s Maduro's removal, Venezuelans weigh hopes for recovery against the harsh reality of surviving on wages that barely cover food.

events.title: Trump flips position on UK's Chagos Islands deal approval
events.description: After initially saying he supported the deal, the US president called it a "big mistake." London stood by the agreement, saying it was the "only way" to guarantee a strategic joint military base with the US.

events.title: Mark Zuckerberg testifies in social media addiction trial
events.description: Google and Mark Zuckerberg's Meta have been accused of deliberately making platforms addictive to children and harming their mental health.

events.title: Europe looks to Australia's social media ban for kids
events.description: Germany has joined the growing list of EU nations that are considering banning children from social media. Australia has banned youths from social media since December ‚Äî and its example has lessons for EU governments.

events.title: Greenland: Denmark's King Frederik X visits Nuuk
events.description: King Frederik is visiting the partly autonomous Danish territory of Greenland, following the tensions prompted by US President Donald Trump last month.

events.title: North Korean POWs stuck in Ukraine as Seoul hesitates
events.description: Two North Korean soldiers in Ukraine have asked to move to South Korea rather than facing dire consequences for letting themselves be captured in the North. The regime might choose to punish their families instead.

events.title: South Africa sends in troops to combat organized crime
events.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa's decision to deploy the military to battle fight crime has elicited mixed reactions from South Africans. Analysts say public confidence can only be restored through a policing overhaul.

events.title: India AI summit: Brazil's Lula lands, US giants tout plans
events.description: Brazil's President Lula da Silva has arrived in New Delhi, while Google and Nvidia hail Indian expansion plans. Meanwhile, China felt the sting of intellectual property appropriation for once in a robot dog scandal.

events.title: Berlinale: Women from Iran, Afghanistan debut bold films
events.description: These two female filmmakers express the injustice they've experienced in their home countries in contrasting genres: a romantic comedy ‚Äî and a nightmarish drama.

events.title: From boom to burden: How overtourism hit European cities
events.description: Many destinations are groaning under the strain of vacationers. So what turns certain places into tourist magnets? It isn't just the famous landmarks.

events.title: For a healthy break, don't check your ex's social media
events.description: It feels harmless to peek at an ex‚Äôs posts on social media. But studies show that repeated checking can intensify heartbreak, prolong longing and slow emotional recovery.

events.title: Ex-Victoria's Secret mogul says Epstein 'stole vast sums from our family'
events.description: A billionaire mogul says paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein stole vast sums from his family.

events.title: Ex-Man Utd star has strong words for Jose Mourinho over racism row
events.description: Former Manchester United player Mikael Silvestre has claimed Jose Mourinho has "failed us" over his response to Vinicius Junior's allegations of racist abuse.

events.title: 'Outrageous' Russia decision sees Ukrainian officials boycott Winter Paralympics

events.title: Drones flown into North Korea by civilians are harming relations, says South Korea
events.description: Drones being flown into North Korea by civilians are harming inter-Korean relations, a South Korean minister has said.

events.title: Jose Mourinho sounded like he was victim blaming - but Vinicius Junior needs empathy over alleged racist abuse
events.description: Vinicius Junior had every right to want to leave the pitch - and for the game to be abandoned.

events.title: Norwegian sets record with 10th Olympic gold medal at Winter Games
events.description: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo has won his fifth Olympic gold medal at the Winter Games - and the 10th of his career.

events.title: Hungary will suspend diesel shipments to Ukraine over interruption to Russian oil supply
events.description: Hungary is halting diesel shipments to Ukraine as a dispute over interrupted Russian oil flows through Ukraine drags on

events.title: Bulgarian president appoints caretaker government and sets snap election date for April 19

events.title: Louvre official says fraud 'inevitable' at large museums as France probes scheme
events.description: The Louvre‚Äôs No. 2 has described a more than 10 million euros ticket fraud scheme as something that was likely inevitable

events.title: UN chief urges renewed push to complete decolonization as 17 territories remain
events.description: More than 60 years after the UN launched its formal decolonization drive, Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres on Monday urged renewed commitment to completing the unfinished business of ending colonial rule.

events.title: Nancy Guthrie disappearance: Former FBI agent reveals amount of time likely needed for advanced DNA testing
events.description: Advanced DNA testing using genealogy databases could take weeks or months to identify Nancy Guthrie's abductor after initial FBI database search failed.

events.title: New poll finds 9% of US adults identify as LGBTQ+ ‚Äî nearly triple the amount recorded in 2012
events.description: Gallup estimated that, according to data gathered in 2025 phone interviews, 9% of U.S. adults identify as LGBTQ+, a figure similar to data from 2024.

events.title: New Jersey Catholic diocese agrees to $180M settlement with survivors of alleged clergy sex abuse
events.description: New Jersey Catholic diocese agrees to pay $180 million to settle alleged clergy sexual abuse claims from about 300 survivors.

events.title: Beloved millionaire Maine philanthropist shot dead in ritzy DC suburb assisted living home, no arrests made
events.description: Millionaire philanthropist shot dead at upscale assisted living facility in Washington D.C. suburb. Robert Fuller Jr., 87, found with severe head trauma.

events.title: 'Devil in the Ozarks' gets more prison time for escaping, now in supermax facility
